captions.text:
Hey Vsauce, I'm Jake and during intense battles
in Pokémon X I started thinking about, in

real life, which pokemon who could kill me.
So I went through the Pokédex and found 3

that would be exceptionally deadly to a human
being, starting with #219...
Magcargo

Magcargo's body temperature is roughly18,000
degrees fahrenheit.

That makes Magcargo 1.77 times hotter than
the surface of the Sun. Because of its incredible

temperature, Magcargo would probably look
like a glowing white orb. Similar to another

glowing white orb, our Sun. We only perceive
the Sun as yellow because of our atmosphere.

What you see when looking at a rainbow is
the rays broken up into the spectrum of their

individual colors and when you mix those colors
back together, you get white.

But back to Magcargo with that temperature
of 18,000 degrees and a radiant energy of

1 GigaWatt, enough to power around 300,000
homes.

The heat would be so intense that you couldn't
get within a couple hundred meters. Anything

around 50 meters or closer would burst into
flame. Now imagine you're walking your 70%

water filled body down the street and suddenly
a wild Magcargo appears right in front of

you. It's possible that the drastic change
in temperature would violently evaporate the

fluid in your body, and all that newly formed
steam trapped below your skin would blow it

off. But that, your brain boiling, flesh burning
and bones being charred happen so quickly

that you and anybody watching wouldn't be
able to tell what happened first.

So yeah Magcargo is pretty hot, but it's not
the hottest. On Vsauce1, Michael has a great

video about how hot things can be which you
should definitely check out if you haven't.
But let's cool off with Blastoise.

"The jets of water Blastoise spouts from the
rocket cannons on its shell can punch through
thick steel.

That actually isn't too far fetched. Waterjet
cutters are industrial tools that use an insanely

high pressure stream of water, anywhere from
40,000 to 100,000 PSI, to cut through steel,

granite and danishes. The stream is also traveling
four times the speed of sound at 1,361.16
m/s.

So now we have a creature with two waterjets
strapped to it's body and taking the Blastoise's

height and scale we can estimate its canons
are roughly 5 inches in diameter each and
could shoot streams at least at 89,000 PSI.

To put that into perspective, the amount of
pressure needed to punch a 5 inch hole through

4 inch thick steel is 30,542psi or almost
3 times less than what Blastoise is rockin.

If we were to turn a water jet on a person,
well... Human skin can withstand 2,175.5 psi

and human bone can withstand 17,549.5. Doctors
at St. Vincent's University Hospital operated

a man who was struck by a jet of water at
3,700 PSI that left a 1cm entry wound and

almost cut entirely through his pancreas.
And that was from a waterjet nozzle only a

hundredth of an inch in diameter. We are dealing
with a stream that would be 5 inches in diameter.

A blast from one of Blastoise's cannons would
most likely blow completely through you or

if it was aimed at your limbs, it would blow
them off. And if there was a steel wall behind

you, it would blow through that too... so
for Blastoise, it would be a victree..bel...pokemon

Victreebel pools in its mouth a fluid with
a honey-like scent, which is really an acid
that dissolves anything.

This pokémon is extremely similar in appearance
and function to tropical pitcher plants. Pitcher

plants are, for the most part, carnivorous.
They attract prey with a bright colored lip

and a sweet smelling nectar. Once the insect
or animal slips inside, it is trapped since

the interior walls of the plant are waxy and
the viscous fluid that fills the plant make

it very difficult for things to ever leave.
The plant slowly dissolves and absorbs the

nutrients of its victim which range from insects,
lizards, or birds.

And dissolving human bodies is nothing new.
People have been doing it for centuries using

acid or lye. Like Adolph Luetgert, known as
the Sausage King of Chicago, who dissolved

his wife in a sausage vat filled with lye.
That murder is thought to be where the urban

legend of human remains being made into sausages
originated. Lye is so good at breaking things
down that it is commonly found in drain cleaners.

So it isn't hard to imagine getting caught
in a 5 foot 7 inch tall Victreebel's mouth
and becoming human soup.

Those are only 3 out of the hundreds of Pokémon
and I'm interested in hearing which ones you

think are deadly so let me know in the comments
below and, as always, thanks for watching.

comments.text:
Muk, Weezing, and Garbodor can easily cause an epidemic of respiratory 
illness and everyone that comes into contact with these Pokemon, made 
completely out of garbage, also run the risk of getting Hantavirus 
Pulmonary Syndrome, Salmonella, and Gangrene since Muk drags along 
practically everything. An overpopulation of Weezing would cause an 
airborne massacre due to too much Carbon Dioxide, Carbon Monoxide, Sulfur 
Dioxide, Flourine compounds, and other fatal gases. Garbodor can harbor 
deadly bacteria in its insides (inside its own garbage juice), forcefully 
spraying this at people in defense. Garbodor, proven by Pokemon Amie, is 
also covered by a layer of sticky garbage. It's not garbage juice but 
garbage jam.﻿

comments.text:
Skarmory : "it flies at speeds of over 180 mph." or 80m/s
It is not so fast, but it have only 70 speed base and 262 max if you take 
all Ev and Iv.
Then if you take a look at Ninjask with a speed up to 160(460 max).
If 80m/S match to 262 speed then you could imagine ninjask real speed in 
m/s is about 140.
If 80m/s match to 70 then ninjask speed is 526m/s.
So the ninjask speed is between 140 and 526m/s.
Ninjask uses its ability "Speed boost" each turn which increase its speed. 
After 6 turn it gains 300% more.
So Ninjask max speed is between 560m/s and 2102m/s, the speed of sound is 
about 340m/s.
For 0.6 meters and 12kg, can Ninjask kill you ?﻿
